meanings.definition: A person who is more knowledgeable about a particular subject than others.
meanings.sent1: She is the privier in our group when it comes to history.
meanings.sent2: The professor is considered the privier in the field of physics.
meanings.sent3: The privier of the team always surprises us with interesting facts.
meanings.sent4: Being the privier in chess, he always wins against his friends.
meanings.sent5: The privier's expertise in astronomy is unmatched.

meanings.definition: More private or secret than something else.
meanings.sent1: The diary was kept in a privier place to protect its secrets.
meanings.sent2: The hidden room was even privier than the attic.
meanings.sent3: She whispered in a privier tone to share the news discreetly.
meanings.sent4: The privier meeting took place under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The privier location of the treasure was finally revealed.

meanings.definition: To make someone aware of something in a private or secret way.
meanings.sent1: He decided to privier her about the surprise party before anyone else.
meanings.sent2: She priviered him about the upcoming changes in the company.
meanings.sent3: The spy priviered the information to his contact in a coded message.
meanings.sent4: She priviered the secret code to access the vault.
meanings.sent5: He priviered the escape plan to his partner in a hushed tone.
